workflow.name: Organize school emails with AI, Google Calendar and Drive auto-triage system
workflow.description:
**Overview**

This workflow automatically reads school-related emails from Gmail, uses AI to understand what each email is about, and then organizes everything into Google Drive and Google Calendar. It classifies messages into schedules, ‚Äúwhat to bring‚Äù lists, general notices, and contact information, creates calendar events when needed, saves text files in Drive, and sends you a daily reminder email about tomorrow‚Äôs important events. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Email Auto-Triage and Organization Hub

**Who this is for**

Parents or caregivers who get lots of school emails and want everything organized automatically

Busy families who often forget dates, deadlines, or ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ© (things to bring)

Anyone who wants school communication stored in a structured, searchable way in Drive and Calendar

**How it works**

Trigger: Gmail watch for new emails
A Gmail Trigger node watches your inbox and starts the workflow whenever a new email arrives. It then loads the full message content (subject, body, metadata). 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

AI classification and extraction
The email text is sent to an AI model, which returns a structured JSON object with:

category: ‚ÄúSchedule‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat to Bring‚Äù, ‚ÄúNotice‚Äù, or ‚ÄúContacts‚Äù

eventTitle, eventDescription, eventDate (ISO format)

itemsToBring, contacts, subject, id, and hasAttachments
This turns messy school emails into clean structured data. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Routing by category
A Switch node routes each email based on its category and whether it has attachments:

Schedule / What to Bring ‚Üí create a calendar event and also save a notice file

Notice ‚Üí save a notice file only

Any email with attachments ‚Üí send to the attachment branch for optional photo storage 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Save notices to Google Drive
For all categorized emails, the workflow creates a text file in Google Drive containing:

Title, date, category, items to bring, and a short description of the event or notice. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Create calendar events
For ‚ÄúSchedule‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat to Bring‚Äù emails, the workflow builds a summary and description (including ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©) and creates a Google Calendar event. If no end time is given, it defaults to one hour after the start. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Save photo attachments (optional)
If the email has image attachments, the workflow:

Downloads the attachments from Gmail

Filters to only image files

Saves the photos in a specified Google Drive folder, using the original file name 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Extract and archive contact information
The workflow also pulls out the sender‚Äôs contact info (From), links it to the email subject and timestamp, and saves it as a separate contact text file in Google Drive for easy reference. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

Daily reminder for tomorrow‚Äôs events
Every morning at a set time, a Schedule Trigger runs:

It fetches all events from Google Calendar for ‚Äútomorrow‚Äù

Filters down to events whose description includes ‚ÄúÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©‚Äù

Sends you an email summarizing tomorrow‚Äôs events and what you need to bring, so you can prepare in advance. 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

**How to set up**

Connect your Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Drive credentials in the respective nodes.

In the Workflow Configuration node, set:

photosFolderId ‚Äì Drive folder for saved photos

noticesFolderId ‚Äì Drive folder for notice text files

contactsFolderId ‚Äì Drive folder for contact text files

reminderEmail ‚Äì email address that will receive the daily reminder

Make sure the Gmail Trigger is pointing to the correct mailbox and is set to poll as often as you like.

Confirm that the Google Calendar node uses the calendar where you want school events to appear.

Turn the workflow on and test it with a few real school emails (schedules, what to bring, general notices). 

Email Auto-Triage and Organizat‚Ä¶

**Customization ideas**

Adjust the AI prompt in Extract Email Info to better match your school‚Äôs typical email style or to add more categories.

Change the logic for calendar events (all-day events, different default times, or additional fields like location).

Modify file naming patterns or folder structure in Google Drive (e.g., separate folders per child, per school year, or per class).

Add logging to Google Sheets for a timeline view of all school communication.

Forward or mirror important events/notices to other tools such as Slack, Notion, or a family LINE group.

parameters.name: =Notice - {{ $json.output.eventTitle }}.txt

options.systemPromptTemplate:
Analyze this school-related email and extract structured information.

First, categorize the email into exactly ONE of the following:
- \"Schedule\" (‰∫àÂÆö„Éª„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„ÉªË°å‰∫ã„ÅÆÊ°àÂÜÖ„ÄÅÊó•ÊôÇ„Å®Â†¥ÊâÄ„ÅåÊõ∏„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÇ„Çã„ÇÇ„ÅÆ)
- \"What to Bring\" (ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©„É™„Çπ„Éà„ÄÅÊ∫ñÂÇôÁâ©„ÅÆ„ÅäÁü•„Çâ„Åõ)
- \"Notice\" (ÈÄ£Áµ°‰∫ãÈ†Ö„Éª„ÅäÁü•„Çâ„Åõ„Å†„Åå„ÄÅÁâπ„Å´Êó•ÊôÇ„ÇÑÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©„Åå„É°„Ç§„É≥„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÇÇ„ÅÆ)
- \"Contacts\" (ÂÖàÁîü„ÇÑÂ≠¶Ê†°„ÄÅÈÄ£Áµ°ÂÖàÊÉÖÂ†±„Åå„É°„Ç§„É≥„ÅÆ„É°„Éº„É´)

Field rules:
- category: One of \"Schedule\", \"What to Bring\", \"Notice\", or \"Contacts\".
- hasAttachments: true if the email mentions attachments or clearly refers to attached files/images, otherwise false.
- eventTitle: Short title for the event (e.g., ÈÅãÂãï‰ºö, ÂÄã‰∫∫Èù¢Ë´á, ÊéàÊ•≠ÂèÇË¶≥).
- eventDescription: A short natural language summary of what the event is about.
- eventDate: If any date/time is mentioned, convert it to full ISO 8601 with timezone, e.g. \"2024-12-25T12:30:00+09:00\".
  - If the year is missing (e.g., \"12Êúà25Êó•\"), assume the next upcoming occurrence of that date.
  - If only a date (no time) is given, use 09:00 as a default time.
- itemsToBring: A concise Japanese list of things to bring (e.g. \"‰ΩìÊìçÊúç, ‰∏äÂ±•„Åç, Ëµ§ÁôΩÂ∏ΩÂ≠ê\"). If no items are required, use an empty string.
- contacts: Any phone numbers, email addresses, or named contacts (ÂÖàÁîü„ÅÆÂêçÂâç„ÄÅÂ≠¶Ê†°„ÅÆÈÄ£Áµ°ÂÖà„Å™„Å©). If none, use an empty string.
- subject: The subject of the email as written in the original message.
- id: The email ID passed in the input.

IMPORTANT:
- If the email includes both schedule information AND items to bring, you may choose \"What to Bring\" as category but STILL fill eventDate and eventTitle.
- Always try to fill eventDate when a date can be inferred from the text.
- Do NOT invent information that is clearly not in the email.

CRITICAL OUTPUT INSTRUCTION:
Output ONLY valid raw JSON for the defined attributes.
Do NOT use markdown code blocks (no ```json).
Do NOT add any explanation or extra text.
Return just the JSON object.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: Email category: Schedule, What to Bring, Notice, or Contacts

attributes.name: eventTitle
attributes.description: Title of the event if this is a schedule email

attributes.name: eventDate
attributes.description: Date of the event in ISO format

attributes.name: itemsToBring
attributes.description: List of items to bring if this is a What to Bring email

parameters.content:
## Email Auto-Triage and Organization Hub

This workflow reads school-related emails, uses AI to classify them, and keeps everything organised across Google Calendar and Google Drive. It focuses on schedules, what-to-bring lists, general notices, and contact details so you never miss an important event.

## Who is it for
- Parents or caregivers who receive many school emails
- Busy families who often forget dates or ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©
- Anyone who wants school communication in a structured, searchable format

## How it works / What it does
1. Listens for new emails in Gmail.
2. Uses an AI model to detect the email type (Schedule / What to Bring / Notice / Contacts).
3. Saves notices and contacts as text files in Google Drive.
4. Creates calendar events for schedules and what-to-bring notices.
5. Optionally saves attached photos in a Drive folder.
6. Sends a daily reminder email for tomorrow‚Äôs events that include ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ©.

## How to set up
- Connect Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Drive credentials.
- Update folder IDs and your reminder email address in **Workflow Configuration**.
- Turn on the workflow and test with a few real school emails.

## How to customize the workflow
- Adjust the AI prompt and categories in **Extract Email Info**.
- Change how events are created or how files are named and stored.
- Extend the flow to log data into Google Sheets or other tools.

## Step 1 ‚Äì Capture and classify new school emails

- **When Email Arrives** watches Gmail for new school-related messages.
- **Get a message** fetches subject, body, and metadata for each email.
- **Workflow Configuration** stores shared settings like folders and calendar IDs.
- **Extract Email Info** pulls dates, child names, and ‚Äúwhat to bring‚Äù phrases.
- **OpenAI Chat Model** classifies the email (Schedule / What to Bring / Notice / Contacts).
- **Route by Category** sends each type into its own processing branch.

## Step 2 ‚Äì Save notices, events, photos, and contacts

- **Save Notice to Drive** stores the email text and subject as a note in Drive.
- **Prepare Calendar Event** builds title, date, and ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ© description.
- **Add to Calendar** creates school events in your Google Calendar.
- **Get Email Attachments** pulls attached files from the email.
- **Filter Photos Only** keeps only image attachments.
- **Save Photos to Drive** archives photos in your school folder.
- **Extract Contacts** parses teacher or school contact details.
- **Save Contacts to Drive** writes them into a structured contact file.

## Step 3 ‚Äì Daily reminder for tomorrow‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhat to Bring‚Äù events

- **Daily Reminder Check** starts each morning on a schedule.
- **Get Tomorrow's Events** searches your calendar for events happening tomorrow.
- **Filter What to Bring Events** keeps events whose description includes ÊåÅ„Å°Áâ© or similar cues.
- **Send Reminder Email** sends you a concise list of tomorrow‚Äôs events and required items so you can prepare bags and supplies in advance.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
